intro: Bulbostylis exilis, commonly known as the slender bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the grass family (Poaceae). It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, often found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant produces tiny, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, greenish or brownish flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense colonies in moist soils. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
